profileAlternative.name: Tim Chevalier
profileAlternative.headline: Programming language researcher and computer science educator
profileAlternative.summary:
I'm an experienced software developer and computer science researcher who is in the process of moving into computer science education.

I'm also interested in technical consulting opportunities related to programming language design and implementation, functional programming, compilation, program verification, type systems, software quality, or static analysis. I have a particular interest in modern typed programming languages like Rust and Haskell, but specific technologies are less important to me than people are.

I'm a skilled writer with experience in technical editing and permissions work, and am also interested in technical writing or editing work.

Languages: Rust, Haskell, Erlang, SML, OCaml, Java, C/C++, et al.

aboutAlternative.text:
I'm an experienced software developer and computer science researcher who is in the process of moving into computer science education.

I'm also interested in technical consulting opportunities related to programming language design and implementation, functional programming, compilation, program verification, type systems, software quality, or static analysis. I have a particular interest in modern typed programming languages like Rust and Haskell, but specific technologies are less important to me than people are.

I'm a skilled writer with experience in technical editing and permissions work, and am also interested in technical writing or editing work.

Languages: Rust, Haskell, Erlang, SML, OCaml, Java, C/C++, et al.

positions.title: Teacher, Academic Talent Development Program
positions.description: ATDP, part of the Graduate School of Education at UC Berkeley, is a program that offers rigorous summer courses to highly motivated young students. I taught two sections of Introduction to Programming in Python to students entering 7th through 11th grades.

positions.title: Teaching Assistant
positions.description: Worked with middle school science students to assist them with their science fair projects, from troubleshooting to proofreading essays. Also substitute taught several different middle school classes.

positions.title: Software Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
positions.description: Site reliability engineer (SRE) for Google App Engine ( https://appengine.google.com ) storage products (Datastore, Task Queue API, Memcache).

positions.title: Principal Software Engineer
positions.description: Worked on a secure cloud sharing back-end in Haskell, using Happstack, Riak, and other technologies.

positions.title: Research Engineer
positions.description: I worked on the compiler, libraries and tools for the Rust programming language: http://rustlang.org/ . I wrote one version of the Rust build system and package manager, implemented one iteration of Rust's object system, and fixed many bugs in the front- and back-end of the Rust-to-LLVM compiler.

positions.title: Research Intern
positions.description: Implemented the typestate system for Rust, a new type-safe systems programming language.

positions.title: Research Assistant
positions.description:
Researched the performance of operating system software written in statically typed functional languages. Implemented a typed compiler middle-end to bridge a compiler front-end for Haskell with a certified compiler back-end.

Worked on designing an extensible intermediate language for certified compilation.
…
see more

positions.title: Freelance scientific and technical editor
positions.description:
I was hired as an independent contractor by American Journal Experts (AJE), which says they've "helped thousands of international researchers to eliminate language barriers and get their work published in the best journals in the world". In 2013, the IRS reclassified me retroactively as an employee of AJE.

I gained valuable experience working for AJE in my role editing scientific papers written by non-native speakers of English.
…
see more

positions.title: Programmer
positions.description: Programmed in Haskell, as an on-site contractor at Fleet Numerical Meterology and Oceanography Center (Monterey, Ca.)

positions.title: Editorial Assistant II
positions.companyName: Institute for Legal Research (University of California, Berkeley)
positions.description: Prepared a manuscript for a 1000-page legal casebook on victimless crime, including converting text to electronic form, editing, proofreading, and communicating with publishers to obtain copyright clearance.

positions.title: Research Intern
positions.description: Re-engineered the demand analyzer portion of the Glasgow Haskell Compiler (GHC), and implemented extensions of it to do further optimization. Also worked on low-level profiling in GHC.

positions.title: Software Engineer (intern)
positions.description: Did implementation and research related to decompilation and other reverse engineering techniques, in the framework of a static analysis software package for C/C++ programs.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Developed the contacts module for LaszloMail, a rich Internet application for web-based email. Contributed to the OpenLaszlo compiler by isolating and fixing bugs. Programmed in OpenLaszlo, Java, and mySQL.

positions.title: Desktop Support Lead
positions.description: Was responsible for Windows and network technical support for an organization of about 100 employees. Did Unix systems administration. Wrote documentation.

given.text: If you have to eat 9 ice creams in one day, call Tim. I recommend Tim for all your ice cream eating needs.

received.text: If you have to eat 12 ice creams in one day, call Chris. Chris can not only satisfy your ice cream eating needs, but motivate, train and mentor others who aspire to similar heights.

items: Dear 'Anonymous' Wellesley Trans Man, Excluding Trans Women Isn't Really About 'Safety'
Killing the Messenger at Mozilla: Hero worship, “meritocracy” and the Eich crisis
Gendered Language: Feature or Bug in Software Documentation? How open source enforces male domination through shaming and hostility
A Certified Framework for Compiling and. Executing Garbage-collected Languages

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Engineering Director of Compiler team at Facebook (We are hiring)
